TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit TransportElement extends System.ServiceModel.Configuration.BindingElementExtensionElement

Docs.summary: Provides a base class to represent a transport binding configuration element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class contains properties that are common to all of the transport binding configuration elements provided by [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]. It handles the translation of the message encoder settings and base transport settings into their run-time manifestations. It delegates the translation of transport-specific settings (for example, HttpProxySettings for HTTP) logic in its concrete derived class transport bindings.

Docs.summary: Initializes this binding configuration element with the content of the specified binding element.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the user takes control of message addressing.
Docs.value: if the user can address every message individually; if the default [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] addressing mechanism automatically creates addresses for all messages. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is usually used in router scenarios, where the application determines which one of several destinations to send a message to.
If this property is set to `true`, the channel assumes the message has already been addressed and does not add any additional information to it.
If this property is set to `false`, the channel adds SOAP addressing information to the message.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size, in bytes, of the buffer pool.
Docs.value: The maximum size of the buffer pool. The default is 524,288 bytes (512 * 1024).

remarks.format: ## Remarks Many parts of [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] use buffers. Creating and destroying buffers each time they are used is expensive, and garbage collection for buffers is also expensive. With buffer pools, you can take a buffer from the pool, use it, and return it to the pool once you are done. Thus the overhead in creating and destroying buffers is avoided.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowable message size, in bytes, that can be received.
Docs.value: The maximum allowable message size that can be received.

Docs.summary: Gets a instance that contains a collection of objects that can be attributes or objects of this configuration element.
Docs.value: A instance that contains a collection of objects that can be attributes or objects of this configuration element.
